715148f-a.text:
The Library of Columbia University, 116th Street, north side, between Broadway and Amsterdam avenue. The building was erected in 1897, from designs by the famous firm, McKim, Mead and White.
about 1912.

717711f-a.text:
Broadway, north from, but not including, 116th Street, favoring the east side. The first street seen, on the left, is 119th Street; 117th and 118th Streets do not intersect Broadway because of the grounds of Columbia University, whose buildings flank Broadway to 119th Street. The U-shaped building on the north side of 119th Street is Barnard College. Behind the college is the Union Theological Seminary. At the extreme left is Grant's Tomb. North of 122nd Street the subway may be seen emerging from its tunnel. From 122nd to 125th Streets, the subway trains run on an elevated trestle, with an
elevated station at 125th Street.
May, 1926.
Brown Brothers.

715147f-a.text:
116 Street, south side, east from but not including Broadway, to and incl ding Amsterdam Ave., showing Columbia University Campus,
dormitories and Halls.
About 1929.
Ewing Galloway.

715145f-a.text:
116th Street, south side, looking west from between Broadway
and Amsterdam Avenue.
July 31, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

717710f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, west side, north from West 116th to 122nd Streets, showing in the foreground, Barnard College and grounds, with the Riverside Baptist Church, overtowering same. The Gothic structure on the extreme right, is a portion of the Administration Building and Library of the Union Theologioal Seminary. Preceding same, is a unit of Barnard College, containing Fiske, Milbank and Brinkerhoff Halls.
1936.
Walter L. Sogert.
(2)
A 1imited view to Wst 120th Street, from a slight altitude, showing the Students Building of Barnard College completely.
1936.
Valter L. Bogert.
(3)
A detail of the same, to a point slightly southward, from a different angle. Right to left appear; the southern portion of the Students' Building of Barnard College, the Barnard College Dormitory, and Brooks
Hall Dormitory.
1936.
Walter L. Bogert.
